thread.title: Sutton United star Roarie Deacon chased by Fulham, Charlton, Cardiff, Millawall and Nottingham Forest
thread.title_full: Sutton United star Roarie Deacon chased by Fulham, Charlton, Cardiff, Millawall and Nottingham Forest

author: whaughton
title: Sutton United star Roarie Deacon chased by Fulham, Charlton, Cardiff, Millawall and Nottingham Forest

organizations.name: news group newspapers ltd roarie deacon

text:
Deacon in Demand Sutton United star Roarie Deacon chased by Fulham, Charlton, Cardiff, Millawall and Nottingham Forest 
The hottest property outside the Football League is a free agent this summer and is being chased by a posse of Championship clubs Exclusive Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SUTTON UNITED hero Roarie Deacon will have the pick of a posse of clubs chasing his signature, including Fulham, Nottingham Forest, Charlton, Cardiff and Millwall. 
Despite the defeat to Arsenal in the FA Cup fifth round on Monday, Deacon was the standout player for the minnows enhancing his reputation as one of the hottest prospects outside the Football League. PA:Press Association Wire 5 Roarie Deacon is wanted by a host of Football League clubs 
Deacon is keen to get back to the full time game after tasting life as pro following his release from Arsenal as a kid, and short spell with Sunderland where he was unable to break into the first team. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest EFL news, gossip and rumours 
The 25-year-old has caught the attention of a host of clubs this season – his exploits have also caught the attention of Jamaican national team boss Theodore Whitmore. 
Deacon is eligible to play for the Reggae Boys via both his parents who were born in the Caribbean. News Group Newspapers Ltd Roarie Deacon’s strike from 25 yards out smashed the Arsenal crossbar News Group Newspapers Ltd Deacon qualifies to play for Jamaica through his parents News Group Newspapers Ltd 5 Sutton United boss Paul Doswell is desperate to hold on to star players 
The midfielder’s agent Liam Bowes of OYM Sports Management, has revealed clubs were in touch with him while he was watching his client play against the Gunners. 
Bowes told SunSport:” I was at the game on Monday night and I was receiving text messages from clubs asking about his availability” Sutton United's Roarie Deacon tells us his Arsenal story and how he cannot wait to meet his old pals 
Despite being a free agent in the summer, Deacon can speak to clubs now and agree a pre-contract, the former Arsenal midfielder is at a vital crossroads in his football life. 
"It's a crucial stage in Roarie's career, his next move needs to be right, he is playing in a good footballing team at Sutton and we want to make sure he continues that momentum in a similar environment" Bowes added. related stories messing room Arsenal accused of lack of respect after leaving non-league Sutton's away changing room in a tip - and they even left milk on the radiator! SHUT YOUR PIE HOLE! GMB's Susanna Reid warns irate Piers Morgan to 'turn the volume down' after rant about Sutton goalie HEADS HELD HIGH Sutton 0 Arsenal 2: United's magical FA Cup run ends as Theo Walcott bags his 100th club goal in gritty encounter DREAM TEAM RATINGS Sutton United v Arsenal: See who shone as the part-timers made Gunners work hard for victory No Chewing Gunners Arsenal stars 'banned' from chewing gum at Sutton United in case it ruins their 3G pitch 
SunSport understands The U's are keen to tie Deacon down to new deal at Gander Green Lane beyond this season, but the former England Under-19 star could decide his next move in the summer. 
Bowes went on to reveal:"Roarie is in no rush to make any decisions now, his contract expires in the summer. PA:Press Association Roarie Deacon celebrates Sutton United 3-1 win at AFC Wimbledon 
Until then he is Sutton United player and is focused on doing the best for them." 
United are back to the reality of the National League when Paul Doswell's side go to fellow strugglers Torquay United on Saturday.
